awd_titl_txt: Instrumentation for Plant Cell and Molecular Biology        Laboratory
awd_abstract_narration: A new laboratory course in Plant Cell and Molecular Biology will                be developed, and laboratories in the existing courses in Plant                 Physiology and Plant Development will be modernized.  The                       equipment to be purchased includes electrophoresis modules, an                  inverted microscope, an upright microscope with fluorescent light               source, a laminar flow sterile transfer hood, a shaking water                   bath with temperature control, a wavelength scanning                            spectrophotometer with linked computer, growth chambers, and                    plant growth tables.  The new course will focus on the isolation,               characterization, and analysis of plant proteins and nucleic                    acid; techniques of cell transformation using Agrobacterium;                    culture manipulations.  This will give the department an                        up-to-date curriculum in modern plant biology.                                                                                                                  The college will provide 50% matching funds.
